description:
Precision Aviation Group (PAG) is a leading provider of Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) services for fixed- and rotor-wing aircraft parts. With 22 repair stations and an inventory of over 200,000 flight-ready line items, PAG supports aviation operators worldwide. PAG specializes in MRO support for Avionics, Components, Engines, and Manufacturing / DER. PAG’s global headquarters is located in Atlanta, GA.

Precisionaviationgroup.com

We have an opening for a Jr. Buyer/Inventory Coordinator position at our Precision Display Repairs (PDR) Camarillo, CA facility.

Job Purpose

The Jr. Buyer/Inventory Coordinator’s primary function is supporting the repair floor operations by insuring timely and accurate procurement and organization of production supplies and repair materials through purchasing and inventory coordination.

Job Duties And Responsibilities

Essential Job Functions:

  • Conducts purchasing activities with operations and engineering departments to acquire inventory in a cost effective and timely manner.
  • Directly supports the repair department by obtaining materials and supplies needed.
  • Monitors the cost, schedule and scope of vendors and suppliers to assure the highest quality at the best price.
  • Monitors vendor pricing to obtain maximum ROI.
  • Issues Purchase Orders and monitors anticipated ETA.
  • Works with accounting to resolve billing and shipping problems.
  • Updates minimum order quantities, lead-times, and other pertinent information.
  • Performs inventory cycle counts and coordinate materials to the service floor.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Physical Demands: May require the following: sitting or standing for extended periods of time; frequent walking, bending, and reaching to shoulder level; occasional squatting, lifting, carrying, pushing or pulling weight up to 20 pounds; repetitive hand movement; eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity; corrected vision and hearing to normal range.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

  • Knowledge and understanding of purchasing processes, policy, and systems.
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite; especially Excel Spreadsheets.
  • Strong time management skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Some negotiation skills a plus.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills to work with team members, clients and suppliers.
  • Excellent attention to detail to ensure all purchase orders are accurate.
  • Math skills to ensure all calculations are correct.

Education/Training: High school diploma; AS in Administration a plus

Experience: A minimum of 5 years of related experience in purchasing and inventory management, or related field preferred.

We offer competitive pay ($26-$29) and a wide variety of benefits. Full time associates qualify for health benefits the first of the month following 30 days’ employment. Options include 4 medical plans, 2 dental plans, vision, base life (company paid), voluntary life, short and long-term disability, flex spending accounts, and telemedicine. Other benefits include vacation and PTO time accrued with each pay cycle with a vacation carryover/payout option at year end, 9 paid holidays, 401k with company match contributions.

Qualified candidates with strong drive, work ethic and commitment to quality are invited to at www.precisionaviationgroup.com using the Careers tab at the bottom of the page.
